y.layout
Interface LabelLayoutKeys

All Known Implementing Classes:
LabelLayoutData
public interface LabelLayoutKeys

This interface provides label-specific keys that can be used to add data providers to a layout graph.

Label aware layout algorithms like HierarchicLayouter may look for such data providers.

Instead of setting up label layout data and data providers one can also use the layout stage LabelLayoutTranslator to automatically translate information provided by the standard label layout classes EdgeLabelLayout and NodeLabelLayout to layout data accessible by the keys defined below.

Field Summary
static Object EDGE_LABEL_LAYOUT_KEY
          Key that is used to add or access a data provider to a graph that must return for each edge of the graph an array of type LabelLayoutData.
static Object IGNORE_LABEL_KEY
          Key that is used to store whether or not a label (i.e., an instance of LabelLayout) should be considered during layout.
static Object NODE_LABEL_LAYOUT_KEY
          Key that is used to add or access a data provider to a graph that must returns for each node of the graph an array of type LabelLayoutData.
 

Field Detail

EDGE_LABEL_LAYOUT_KEY

static final Object EDGE_LABEL_LAYOUT_KEY
Key that is used to add or access a data provider to a graph that must return for each edge of the graph an array of type LabelLayoutData.

NODE_LABEL_LAYOUT_KEY

static final Object NODE_LABEL_LAYOUT_KEY
Key that is used to add or access a data provider to a graph that must returns for each node of the graph an array of type LabelLayoutData.

IGNORE_LABEL_KEY

static final Object IGNORE_LABEL_KEY
Key that is used to store whether or not a label (i.e., an instance of LabelLayout) should be considered during layout. A label is ignored if the data provider registered with this key is not null and DataProvider.getBool(Object) returns true.

Currently this key is directly considered by the following layout algorithms: EdgeRouter. Furthermore, layout stage LabelLayoutTranslator only translates labels that should not be ignored.
